content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 8 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 2. f of x is negative 8. Column 2. x is 2.9. f of x is negative 80. Column 3. x is 2.99. f of x is negative 800. Column 4. x is 2.999. f of x is negative 8000. Column 5. x is 3.001. f of x is 8000. Column 6. x is 3.01. f of x is 800. Column 7. x is 3.1. f of x is 80. Column 8. x is 4. f of x is 8." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 4em 4em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>80</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>800</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>8000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8000</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>800</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>80</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
The table above gives values of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following conclusions is supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
